title: Basic html week input test
description: A basic html week input test.

narrator.edge: unable to change the value without using the date picker widget

chrome.output: input was not focused
input was not found
unable to get to the control
input was not recognized
"week, datetime, edit"
chrome.notes: each part of the date (week and year) is rendered as its own tab stop and control

chrome.output: "enter a date, date time edit, 2012-W12, week, enter a date, edit, spin box, 12"
"enter a date, datetime edit, week 12 2012, show week picker"
in list of form fields as "enter a date 2012-W12"
new value was announced if using embedded controls but not the picker widget

results.notes: for example, if you press "up arrow" or "down arrow" on any of the embedded spin boxes

chrome.output: embedded controls for week and year are conveyed correctly.

edge.notes: each part of the date (week and year) is rendered as its own tab stop and control

results.notes: pass because the value is conveyed for each embedded control

edge.output: "week, enter a date, spin button, 12, minimum 1, and maximum 53"
after changing the value in the widget and activating the button accept button, the date input was focused but the new value was not conveyed.

results.notes: Scan mode must be manually turned off to interact with widgets

edge.output: embedded controls for month and year are conveyed correctly and operable

results.notes: pass because embedded widgets convey the value

results.notes: pass because embedded controls convey the value

results.notes: for example, if you enter "1" into the month field, "1" is announced followed by "01"

chrome.output: embedded controls for week and year are conveyed correctly, however controls within the date picker are not conveyed.

results.notes: fail because the new value was not conveyed after closing the widget

history.message: Added Narrator results for NVDA and JAWS, updated NVDA+Chrome results.
